description: Generic file write events for files not covered by specialized file type events. Provides broad visibility into file system writes, useful for detecting unusual file activity and data staging.

columns.name: aid
columns.description: Agent ID - unique identifier for the endpoint

columns.name: cid
columns.description: Customer ID - unique identifier for the CrowdStrike tenant

columns.name: UserName
columns.description: Username associated with the file write

columns.name: TargetFileName
columns.description: Full path to the written file

columns.name: FileName
columns.description: Base filename of the written file

columns.name: ContextProcessId
columns.description: Falcon's unique process identifier for the writing process

columns.name: WritingProcessFileName
columns.description: Base filename of the process that wrote the file

columns.name: MD5HashData
columns.description: MD5 hash of the written file

columns.name: SHA256HashData
columns.description: SHA256 hash of the written file

columns.name: IsOnRemovableDisk
columns.description: Indicates if the file was written to removable media (USB drive, external HDD, etc.)
columns.note: Found in production queries but not in official CrowdStrike documentation

common_operations: Join with ProcessRollup2 via ContextProcessId for writing process details
Catch file types not covered by specialized events
Monitor writes to removable media for data exfiltration
